info.title: Voucherify API
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details.

post.description:
> â—ï¸ Deprecated > > This endpoint represents the deprecated version of the API responsible for qualification, and we do not recommend using it. The new [Qualifications API](ref:examine-qualification) introduces additional features and improvements while maintaining backward compatibility. Developers are encouraged to migrate to the latest version to take advantage of the latest enhancements and bug fixes. No updates will be provided to the deprecated endpoint. Display vouchers qualified to the given customer and context (e.g., order, loyalty reward). Checks up to 50 **generic (standalone) voucherss**. > ðŸ‘ Prevailing assumption > You data is synced with Voucherify. ## How does this endpoint work? A property's value that does not meet a validation rule requirement will disqualify that particular voucher and it will not be listed in the results. As a sample use case, you can imagine a requirement of displaying coupons available for the customer below the shopping cart. The customer can choose and apply the proposed voucher. ## What's excluded? The verification logic won't run against _coupons from bulk unique code campaigns_. For campaigns with multiple unique codes, you should run a [dedicated function](ref:examine-campaigns-qualification) for searching and identifying qualified campaigns. ## Customizing the response > ðŸ“˜ Query parameters let you sort and filter the returned vouchers > > Customize your response: > - If you only care about verifying a customer, use `audienceRulesOnly` set to `true`. >- If you want to limit the number of vouchers to be returned from the entire pool of eligible vouchers, set a `limit`. This will return vouchers sorted by `-created_at`, by default beginning with the most recent vouchers listed at the top. > - If you have a preference on the sorting order of the returned vouchers, you can use `order` to customize your response. ## Sending the request body payload ## Customer You have the option of sending customer data via the dedicated `customer` object in the request body or a nested `customer` object within the `order` object. ### Available options: - You can either pass a customer `id` (Voucherify system generated), - a `source_id` (your own unique internal customer identifier e.g., email, database ID, CRM id), - a combination of the remaining parameters in the customer object, - a combination of customer `id` and remaining parameters excluding `source_id`, or - a combination of `source_id` and remaining parameters excluding `id` #### Note: For the latter two options, if you pass the `source_id` or the `id` with the other parameters, the logic will run independently for parameters explicitly passed in the request body versus those not explicitly passed in the request body. For _parameters not explicitly listed in the payload_, the verification will be against the data stored for that customer in the system. On the other hand, for any _parameter values explicitly passed in the payload_, the logic will ignore those stored in the system and will use the new values provided in the qualification request body. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule). ## Order ### Available options: - You can either pass an order `id` (Voucherify system generated), - a `source_id` (your own unique internal order identifier), - a combination of the remaining parameters in the order object, - a combination of order `id` and remaining parameters excluding `source_id`, or - a combination of `source_id` and remaining parameters excluding `id` #### Note: For the latter two options, if you pass the `source_id` or the `id` with the other parameters, the logic will run independently for parameters explicitly passed in the request body versus those not explicitly passed in the request body. For _parameters not explicitly listed in the payload_, the verification will be against the data stored for that order in the system. On the other hand, for any _parameter values explicitly passed in the payload_, the logic will ignore those stored in the system and will use the new values provided in the qualification request body. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule). ## Guidelines: To validate against vouchers with total order `amount` requirements, make sure to include the total order `amount` in the order object or alternatively the `amount` for _every_ order item (the application will then add each amount to get the total and perform the qualification checks). If the total order `amount` is provided along with the individual items' amounts, the total order `amount` will take precedence. | **Case** | **Order-Level Parameter Included** | **Item-Level Parameter Included** | **Precedence** | **Calculation Result** | **Parameter included in payload accounts for checks against requirements in these validation rules** | |:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|---|---| | **1** | `amount` | `amount` | Order-level | Uses order-level `amount` | - Total order amount | | **2** | | `amount` | Item-level | Sums each item-level `amount` | - Total order amount
- subtotal of matched items | | **3** | | `price`
`quantity` | Item-level | Multiplies each item's (`price` x `quantity`) to get item `amount` and then adds each item's `amount` to get total order `amount` | - Total order amount
- Subtotal of matched items
- Unit price of any matching order line
- Price of each item/Price of any item | | **4** | | `amount`
`price`
`quantity` | Item-level `amount` | Uses item-level `amount` for total order `amount` calculation, ignores (`price` x `quantity`) calculation | - Total order amount (uses item `amount` if provided or `price` x `quantity` for items without `amount` property; `amount` takes precedence in case all 3 properties are provided for an item)
- Subtotal of matched items (uses item `amount`, takes precedence if all 3 properties are provided)
- Unit price of any matching order line
- Price of each item/Price of any item | | **5** | `amount` | `amount`
`price`
`quantity` | Order-level | Uses order-level `amount` for total order `amount` | - Total order amount (uses order-level `amount`).
- Subtotal of matched items (see case **4** for details).
- Unit price of any matching order line
- Price of each item/Price of any item | ## Reward ## Gift Card

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of vouchers to be qualified.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash `-` means sorting in a descending order.

requestBody.description: Should contain given customer and context such as an order.

200.description: This operation returns the list of valid and active vouchers based on the qualification of given context (e.g., customer profile, redemptions metadata, order).

audienceRulesOnly.name: audienceRulesOnly
audienceRulesOnly.description: This parameter set to true will ask only for verifying vouchers' validation rules only against conditions applied to audiences' attributes (belonging into segment, customer metadata, customer redemption count). The remaining checks against limits and rules will be omitted during validation.

order.description: Tracks purchase transactions. You can send the order in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing order in Voucherify's system that will be linked to the redemption of this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API. You can send the order id in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

amount.description:
Pre-discount order amount represents the total amount of order items' amounts (sum of each item's `amount` property). You can send the total order amount or the amount of each item individually in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific total order amount validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_ 

The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

items.description: List of Order Items constituting the order. Order items can be defined either by `product_id` or `sku_id`. For every item, you must define the quantity.

referrer.description: The person who referred the customer to make the order.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Order metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _ORDER METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `list`.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of qualified vouchers.

total.description: Total valid and active vouchers matching the qualification criteria in given context.

id.description: Unique qualification ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the qualification was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_custome.title: Customer Object
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_custome.description: This object stores customer details. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific customer validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer segment_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Customer Activity_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to the redemption in this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API.

source_id.description: A unique customer identifier. This is a tracking identifier of a user that is validating a voucher. The `source_id` is built based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). If you also pass a customer ID, the source ID will be ignored. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source ID you provide must either be a token, like the one returned in the original voucher validation method done by a specific customer, or a string identifying the customer (e.g., email, database ID, CRM ID).

name.description: First and Last Name. You can send the name in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific name validation rules to be satisfied.

email.description: You can send the email in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific email validation rules to be satisfied.

phone.description: You can send the phone in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific phone validation rules to be satisfied.

address.description: A set of key/value pairs which describes the address. You can send the address in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific address validation rules to be satisfied.

city.description: You can send the city in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific city validation rules to be satisfied.

country.description: You can send the country in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific country validation rules to be satisfied.

postal_code.description: You can send the postal code in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific postal code validation rules to be satisfied.

state.description: You can send the state in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific state validation rules to be satisfied.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **customer** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer metadata satisfy_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

birthdate.description: You can send the birthdate in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific birthdate validation rules to be satisfied.

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description: Schema model for a product item. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

source_id.description:
A unique product identifier from your inventory system. __Requires__ the `related_object` property to be defined. 

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on Source Id filters_ . [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

related_object.description: A reference to the object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_sku.title: SKU Item
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_sku.description: Schema model for a SKU item.

source_id.description:
A unique sku identifier from your inventory system. __Requires__ the `related_object` property to be defined. 

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on Source Id filters_ . [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description:
Represents a total amount of order item (price * quantity).

You should provide it to retrieve `discount_amount` if the discount is applied only to this item.[I'm not sure what this means here, it's from the original docs]

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

related_object.description: A reference to the object containing details of the related product/sku. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a SKU.

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item using product_id
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description:
Schema model for a product item sent using the `product_id`. 

You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. 
The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. Even if this price is explicitly provided, it will not override the `price` when running qualifications against _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select/create a product collection filtered by a Price_.   [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item using source_id
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description: Schema model for a product item. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

source_id.description:
A unique product identifier from your inventory system. __Requires__ the `related_object` property to be defined. 

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on Source Id filters_ . [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

related_object.description: A reference to the object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

Voucher.title: Voucher
Voucher.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories and validation rules assignments.

VoucherBase.title: Voucher Base
VoucherBase.description: This is an object representing a voucher.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

Category.title: Category
Category.description: This is an object representing a category.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rules assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rules assignments.

data.description: Contains array of validation rules assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assignments.

6_res_applicable_to_object.title: Included  Items
6_res_applicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of included products, SKUs, and product collections. These can be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount can apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of included objects.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about included products, SKUs, or product collections in a dictionary.

6_res_inapplicable_to_object.title: Excluded Items
6_res_inapplicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that **do not** qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of excluded products, SKUs, and product collections. These **CANNOT** be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount cannot apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining excluded products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of excluded objects.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about excluded products, SKUs, or product collections in a dictionary.

ValidityTimeframe.title: Validity Timeframe
ValidityTimeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

ValidityDayOfWeek.title: Validity Day Of Week
ValidityDayOfWeek.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

ValidityHours.title: Validity Hours
ValidityHours.description: Determines the hours of validity, e.g. to create a happy hours scenario.

daily.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource is active. The periods should not overlap.

items.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource will be active.

start_time.description: Defines the starting hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive before* this time.

days_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the resource is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3`  Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

expiration_time.description: Defines the ending hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive after* this time.

VoucherAssets.title: Voucher Assets
VoucherAssets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

id.description: The unique identifier for a assignment

rule_id.description: The unique identifier for a rule

related_object_id.description: The unique identifier for a related object

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

validation_status.description: The validation status of the assignment

6_res_product_collection.title: Product Collection
6_res_product_collection.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_product_collection_unit.title: Product Collection for Unit Discount
6_res_product_collection_unit.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

6_res_product_collection_fixed_amount.title: Product Collection for Fixed Amount Discount
6_res_product_collection_fixed_amount.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `price_formula` parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

object.description: This object stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

object.description: This object stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

object.description: This object stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `price_formula` parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_sku.title: SKU
6_res_sku.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

object.description: This object stores information about the product variant.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The source ID from your inventory system.

product_id.description: Parent product's unique ID assigned by Voucherify.

product_source_id.description: Parent product's source ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_sku_unit.title: SKU for Unit Discount
6_res_sku_unit.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

object.description: This object stores information about the product variant.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The source ID from your inventory system.

product_id.description: Parent product's unique ID assigned by Voucherify.

product_source_id.description: Parent product's source ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

6_res_sku_unit_fixed_amount.title: SKU for Amount Discount
6_res_sku_unit_fixed_amount.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

object.description: This object stores information about the product variant.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The source ID from your inventory system.

product_id.description: Parent product's unique ID assigned by Voucherify.

product_source_id.description: Parent product's source ID from your inventory system.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `price_formula` parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_product_collection_excluded.title: Product Collection
6_res_product_collection_excluded.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

object.description: This product stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_sku_excluded.title: SKU
6_res_sku_excluded.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

object.description: This object stores information about the product variant.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The source ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.
Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

scopes.api: Gives access to whole server-side API.
scopes.vouchers: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `v1/vouchers`.
scopes.client_api: Gives access to whole client-side API.
scopes.client_vouchers: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/vouchers`.
scopes.promotions: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/promotions`.
scopes.client_promotions: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/promotions`
scopes.campaigns: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `v1/campaigns`.
scopes.client_publish: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/publish`.
scopes.exports: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/exports`.
scopes.publications: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/publications`.
scopes.client_validate: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/validate`.
scopes.validations: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/validations`.
scopes.client_validations: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/validations`.
scopes.qualifications: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/qualifications`.
scopes.client_qualifications: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/qualifications`.
scopes.client_redeem: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/redeem
scopes.redemptions: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/redemptions`.
scopes.client_redemptions: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/redemptions`
scopes.customers: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/customers`.
scopes.client_customers: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/customers`.
scopes.orders: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/orders`.
scopes.products: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/products`.
scopes.skus: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/skus`.
scopes.validation-rules: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/validation-rules`.
scopes.validation-rules-assignments: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/validation-rules-assignments
scopes.segments: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/segments`.
scopes.events: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/events`.
scopes.client_events: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `client/v1/events`.
scopes.rewards: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/rewards`.
scopes.assets: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/assets`.
scopes.task-results: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/task-results`.
scopes.loyalties: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/loyalties`.
scopes.client_consents: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `client/v1/consents`.
scopes.consents: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/consents`.
scopes.async-actions: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/async-actions`.
scopes.product-collections: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/product-collections`.
scopes.categories: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/categories`.
scopes.metadata-schemas: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/metadata-schemas`.
scopes.locations: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/locations`.
scopes.referrals: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/referrals`.
scopes.trash-bin: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/v1/trash-bin`.
